full_text:
Ahead of tomorrow's games, here are the NFL's Best Performers on Thanksgiving Day.
üèà No surprise to see Jason Witten on the list (16 games!)
üèà Tom Brady comes to play on Turkey Day
üèà Mark Sanchez obviously remains an NFL Thanksgiving icon

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/OMPV7o455y

Welp, I am extremely mad at myself.  After running this week's simulations and seeing that - checks notes - the @steelers were estimated to be the 3rd best team in the nation, I knew something was amiss.  #nflverse https://t.co/2zq0HRlbTr

So I went digging through my code, and low and behold, a single instance in which I called "predict" on a gamlss object, but used "new_data" instead of "newdata", meaning that the simulation was looping through training data predictions #nflverse

This, of course, was not ideal, and while its issue was mitigated by the other parts of the algorithm, it obviously was causing incorrect outcomes, and therefore, poor estimates of strength and game-by-game predictions.  I am deeply sorry if I have misled you :( #nflverse

Code is fixed now, and the model hasn't changed from the original design (I think I know when I made this mistake, which was during some cleanup around Week 6, but don't know for sure).  Either way, here are the models predictions for the rest of the year #nflverse https://t.co/3xsP4AmzMx
And this week's games - which I hope will improve my standing in @FiveThirtyEight and @LeeSharpeNFL prediction game #nflverse https://t.co/Sq6TLExfGG

And here are estimates of "true" team strength, which seems far more in line with my own thinking than some of the bolder claims happening earlier in the year (which I attributed to some latent strength observed in the data, which was likely more just code error) #nflverse https://t.co/0iJGv3jlKm

I'll eventually go back and perform some retrodiction on a week by week basis to reproduce the trend charts, but that's for another day after I finish eating away my code error sorrows tomorrow - happy Thanksgiving y'all, and sorry again! #nflverse
